title: Lanczos algorithm
summary: The Lanczos algorithm is an iterative method devised by Cornelius Lanczos that is an adaptation of power methods to find the m {\displaystyle m} "most useful" (tending towards extreme highest/lowest) eigenvalues and eigenvectors of an n Ã— n {\displaystyle n\times n} Hermitian matrix, where m {\displaystyle m} is often but not necessarily much smaller than n {\displaystyle n} .[1] Although computationally efficient in principle, the method as initially formulated was not useful, due to its numerical instability.
